StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_MIDeleteSpecialExam]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@MarineCandidateID int, @ExamType varchar(4), @ExamDate date.me, @UserLogin varchar(15) AS
SET NOCOUNT ON
DECLARE @DBID int DECLARE @DBNAME sysname DECLARE @ErrMsg varchar(100)
SELECT @DBID = DB_ID(), @DBNAME = DB_NAME()
IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CANDIDATE_SPECIAL_EXAM CSE WHERE CSE.MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateID AND CSE.SPECIAL_EXAM_TYPE = @ExamType AND CSE.SPECIAL_EXAM_DATE = @ExamDate) BEGIN --- START THE TRANSACTION --- BEGIN TRANSACTION
--- UPDATE THE USER_LOGIN FOR THE T LOG BEFORE DELETING THE RECORD UPDATE CANDIDATE_SPECIAL_EXAM SET USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GETDATE() WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateID AND SPECIAL_EXAM_TYPE = @ExamType AND SPECIAL_EXAM_DATE = @ExamDate
--- DELETE THE MEDICAL EXAM DELETE FROM CANDIDATE_SPECIAL_EXAM WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateID AND SPECIAL_EXAM_TYPE = @ExamType AND SPECIAL_EXAM_DATE = @ExamDate
IF @@ROWCOUNT = 0 BEGIN --- ROLLBACK TRANSACTION SET @ErrMsg = 'There is no special exam record to delete for Marine Candidate ' + CONVERT(VARCHAR, @MarineCandidateID) + '.' RAISERROR (@ErrMsg, 16, 2, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END
--- IF WE MAKE IT HERE COMMIT THE TRANSACTION --- COMMIT TRANSACTION END
--- CLEAN UP SET NOCOUNT OFF
